Class PointComparator

  • java.lang.Object
    • PointComparator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<java.awt.geom.Point2D>

    public class PointComparator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<java.awt.geom.Point2D>
    Comparator for points. Can compare based on position or polar angle.
    Author:
    Devin Tuchsen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PointComparator()
      Constructs a new PointComparator that will compare based on position.
      PointComparator(java.awt.geom.Point2D origin)
      Constructs a new PointComparator that will compare based on polar angle.

    • Method Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • PointComparator

        public PointComparator()
        Constructs a new PointComparator that will compare based on position.

      • PointComparator

        public PointComparator(java.awt.geom.Point2D origin)
        Constructs a new PointComparator that will compare based on polar angle.
        Parameters:
        origin - origin point around which to compute polar angles

    • Method Detail

      • compare

        public int compare(java.awt.geom.Point2D p1,
          java.awt.geom.Point2D p2)
        Compares its two arguments for order. Returns a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the first argument is less than, equal to, or greater than the second. If an origin was specified, comparison will be based on polar angle. Otherwise, it is based upon position.
        Specified by:
        compare in interface java.util.Comparator<java.awt.geom.Point2D>
        Parameters:
        p1 - the first point to be compared
        p2 - the second point to be compared
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the first argument is less than, equal to, or greater than the second
